The Temple of Aphrothera was a home to a Fairy known far and wide for her beauty and power. It was said that any who could face the temples hardships and trials would be granted a power from Aphrothera herself. For Link, this power could be useful in the continuing struggles to protect Hyrule from the forces of evil. There was just one problem: The Temple of Aphrothera could only be accessed by a woman. And Link was a man. Which brings us to where we are.

Link stood patiently in the center of circle drawn in chalk. Around the edges were mystic symbols. And on either side of Link were the symbols for man and woman. Princess Zelda finished the last of the symbols before stepping back to see if the symbols matched up correctly. Once she was sure she looked to Link.

"Alright Link, everything is in place. Are you still sure you want to go through with this?" Zelda asked in concern. Changing genders was an extreme thing to do. While she respected Link's courage, she often found his desire for adventure to dip into stupidity. While she could see why taking the challenge of the Temple could be rewarding, it wasn't exactly necessary.

Link looked back to Zelda, stern look in his eye, and nodded firmly. He was determined to see this adventure to the end.

Zelda gave a sigh of resignation. "Alright, let's get this over with."

As Zelda concentrated on her magic, focusing it through her hands and into the circle surrounding Link. As the magic took affect, the chalk lines began to glow a soft purple. The purple light the spread into the circles center towards Link and passed up his body. The changes were immediate. First his feet shrank. Then his legs became smooth and shapely. Link was enjoying a day at the fishing hole long after the defeat of Ganondorf. After all of the excitement and adventure, it was nice to have a quiet afternoon for once. Queen Zelda's castle was being rebuilt and the Bulblins made peace with the rest of Hyrule. Link sighed, content with the state of the world at last. Could things get any better than this?

Reacting quickly, the Hero of Light began reeling in the unknown creature, who was strong enough to give even a hero as strong as Link a difficult time. "Y'all better let me go, partner, 'fore I slap you in the head!"

"Lookee here," The fish said, "I ain't no reg'lar fish. Ah'm a magic fish. Set me free and you'll get something really cool!"

Link puts the lace headband in his inventory and travels to Hateno Village, arriving at his house.

This sidequest will mean something very valuable in Link's life, not realizing that he will be transformed into a sexy woman, yet wearing a french maid outfit if only he wears the black and white lace headband with white bows on the sides.

Shall we begin this new story?
1553221212222.title: Another story!

choices: Link encounters someone on the way...
15532212122221.content:
It all began in one afternoon on the hills of hyrule, next to a destroyed village where Link was exploring around in hopes of discovering a new sheikah shrine.

"Man, no luck." Link whispered as he looked down a well.

He had not checked the houses, so that could mean something good... Or bad?
Moreover, Link searched the small houses first and found green ruppees. He then walked to the medium houses and found a traveler's sword and shield, but Link did not need them right now, there were no enemies and the blood moon would appear the next night.

Before Link gave up, he saw a big house, or rather a mansion.

"Woah, this place must have been pretty wealthy. Perhaps this mansion has something valuable." Link commented as he arrived at the mansion.

Link pushed the rusty door, and to his surprise, water came out and splashed all the way to his champions tunic.

"Great, just what I needed." Link said with anger.

Once he was inside the mansion, a small breeze of air passed through him and made him shiver.

"Strange... Why did I shiver? It felt like... Fear." Link whispered once again.

Link soon walked around the old mansion and there were so many rooms, more rooms than his house in hateno village!

In Link's exploration, he encountered chests that had red and purple ruppees, and even better, he discovered that this village had a relationship with the townsfolk of Hateno village, loking at pictures showing the buildings of Hateno village.

Link thought he had explored every corner of the mansion, but he encountered something interesting, a room that was locked and thr door was not broken or rusty, it was clean and kept a strong jold of material.

"That is strange. Maybe this room was very special to thepeople in this mansion.I do not want to go there, but I feel it is urgent for me to find out." Link thought, but before he knew it, he was at the door.

Link tried to open the door normally, but it was locked.
He did not worried about it so then he summoned his sledgehammer, which was about to break, and used all of it to break the door. The hammer broke, but Link was now able to enter the room.

Another small breeze came by and made Link shiver, but Link went with the fact it must have been his wet clothes.

The room was clean and organized, but the thing Link noticed about this room was that it must have been a woman's room. He knew that because there was a mirror and a desk, alongside a chair, that was used for women to do their makeup. Link knew this because he has visited a lot of houses where he encounters woman doing their makeup.

He searched the room, but it all seemed empty, with no clothes or ruppees to be found. But before Link left, he saw something shining under bed and quickly Link moved the bed to one side of the room and found a special chest.

The chest was pink and gold, but it was odd for Link that the gold shined in the nighttime. There was no light.

Nonetheless, Link knew this was a feminine treasure chest, but perhaps it had something very special he can use in his adventure.

Link opened the chest and obtaine a....
Black and white lace headband with white bows on the sides?

"I.. Ummm..." Link stared in confusion.

This was a piece of headgear, but it looked extremely feminine. He would not wear that as he did with tge gerudo clothing.

Link was about to leave the lace headband, but in his mind the headband looked important and perhaps useful to him.... Maybe if he wore it?

No, Link would do that, and as he tried to put the black and white lace headband with white bows on the sides back to the treasure chest, it was gone. What Link saw now was a piece of paper that when Link picked it up and read it, it said:
"To the person who obtained the
Black and white lace headband with
white bows on the sides, you will be awarded
With a nice reward that will aid you in your life
And so much more that pleases you. But first,
You must head to a house that is about to
Be destroyed in Hateno Village. Go there and
More information will be given about the reward."

Link was now intrigued about this quest as he would obtain a reward that will help him on his journey. And the location the paper told Link to go was his own house because he bought the house that was about to be destroyed.

Therefore, Link headed to his house in Hateno Village!

15532212231211111.title: Amali wants out!

155322122312111111.content:
Link needed some sleep.

He had just spent the past few hours aboard the Divine Beast Vah Medoh, battling the blight that infected the weapon all those years ago. As if battling a Blight wasn't straining enough, he met with Revali and freed his spirit. Even with his loss of memory, he still felt connected to the Champions, feeling guilty for being the only survivor. After being gifted with Revali's Gale, he was transported back to Rito Village, where he now found himself. He would have been content to head to the Inn, if he didn't run into Amali on the way.

"Oh, Mister Link! You look exhausted, I have an extra bed if you need somewhere to stay." The Rito said with a motherly tone.

"I was going to sleep at the Inn." Link said, weighing his options. "Sure, will Kass be ok with this?"

"Oh, Kass and the kids are on a....musical retreat for the night. They'll be back tomorrow evening." She said, ecstatic that he agreed. Her plan would be alot easier to implement in the safety of her home.

Link followed the woman up the winding steps of the village untill they reached her home. Without Kass's music or the children screaming it was peaceful, reminded Link of his own home back in Hateno. Amali showed Link to the open cot and he didn't hesitate, immediately taking his gear off and falling onto the bed, asleep within second.
155322122312111111.title: Yes!

155322122321.content:
On top of a cliff, where boulders dominated the landscape and plant life was scarce, Zelda stood, looking at the zoomed in pictures of Divine Beast Va Ruta on her sheikah slate.

She frowned. "That's odd," she said, "Va Ruta stopped functioning a few hours ago, but now she is back online again. Strange."

Zelda turned her attention back to the colossal machine, which was swimming around in the waters of the Zoren's huge dam. It was odd, Zelda thought, to go offline like that. She was pondering different theories, trying to come to a logical conclusion.

She was suspecting Calamity Ganon was to blame. Or perhaps It was the the aftereffects of the malice that had corrupted it. Or perhaps it was just a technical glitch. These things were machines, after all.

"What do you think, Link?" Zelda asked to her companion.

When there was no reply, she turned around, but Link was no where in sight, and Zelda got worried.

"Link!" she called, "Link!"

The sound of heavy panting filled the air, and over the boulder climbed the tubby form of Zelda's companion. He was exhausted, she saw, large sweat stains visible under his tight clothing. He lifted his hand to signal to her that he was on his way.

He dropped off the rock, nearly losing his footing, and did a half jog towards her, his fat roles jiggling and his large stomach bouncing up and down. In her absence, and thanks to the bountiful food available across the lands of Hyrule, Link had put on a lot of weight on his quest to save the world.

When he had first defeated Ganon and freed her, he was weighing close to 210 pounds, with a growing belly visible on the folds of his clothing. Now he weighed close to 305 pounds! Zelda knew that she should scowled Link for letting himself go like this, perhaps try and whip him back into shape.

But she found that she just couldn't. She didn't know why, but there was just something that attracted her about his weight gain. Perhaps it was his moon face, his developing second chin, or maybe it was the fact that he just looked...well, big all over.

To her, Link seemed to poses every masculine trait that could be asked of a man.

Zelda just shook her head. "Let's go," she said, "We need to get back to the Zoren and report this."
